reviews.text: Simply amazing! Definitly worth a visit. From 'the boy' over the rainbow terrace to the temporary exhibition - there are so many amazing art experiences worth discovering.

Some very beautiful or interesting and thought-provoking works, but also a lot of lame and pretentious stuff as can be expected from modern arts. If you enjoy modern art you should really like this museum and its exhibits.
A must see place in Aarhus. The rainbow glasses on top of the roof is amazing. The views are beautiful from the roof. Food and drinks and very clean toilet facilities. Parking very nearby.
A must see attraction in Aarhus. The view from the top rainbow structure is spectacular. Just over an hour drive from Billund Airport. Restaurants, toilet facilities and car park.
If you like art, Aros is the perfect place. Always great exhibitions plus a nice 360 view from the roof. A little pricy but that is Denmark for you. I always bring tourists here.

Amazing open air museum with original historic buiödings from Denmark transferred to this location and arranged in a coherent village. Most of the houses are open for visit with descriptions on their original purpose. In some of the houses you'll find people working in original outfits and selling different things (bakery, book store, cakes, etc). Furthermore, you can visit a museum on the history of Aarhus, which is great. I really recommend a visit!

Brilliant recreation of historical buildings and artifacts from all over Denmark from centuries ago to recent history. The shops and flats from the 1970s were especially fine in my opinion. Absolutely must see.

This assembled village demonstrates more than 300 years of history in Denmark. It's a living museum with homes and shops and other historic buildings from around Denmark. In 3 or 4 hours here you get a great idea of Danish history and life style. Actors in period costumes show and tell what life was really. Don't miss this special place and tell your friends about it.
very interesting and interactive museum. it is nice to see and feel how people actually lived in the past. very accurate reconstruction.

Very cozy and so informative and interesting history that I did never think of. A much visit when you are in Aarhus! And make sure you are there early so you manage to see everything before they close.

Amazing place. We were so surprised to find two retro game machines there to play for free. One could also use console to play games, but it was stolen. 

Outside the playground for children is also amazing.

Such a nice model for a caring city to its citizens.
A truly amazing place. There should be one of these in every city.
Great library with many activities for all ages
Best place to hang out in.
Great library and cultural space with a large car park underneath. Lots of locals and families here too. Free to wander around in, but it looks more impressive from outside, especially at night.

Located in the old city hall, they had displays on 4 floors when I visited. Ranging from a history of women's achievements and rights movement to a thought provoking piece about the meaning of gender bending burlesque, the displays got you thinking about how you personally think about gender. It was encouraging to see the progress and also disappointing to see the length of time required. Peter Land's exhibit was funny, odd and eerie. Nice way to end the visit.

Lovely old building. Some exhibitions unfinished. Probably more interesting for younger folk who don't remember as .much!
Toilets and cafe.

Great museum with creative exhibitions offering interestig, critical and original views on society regarding women, gender inequality and gender roles. I particularly liked the 'gender blender', which offered a deep insight into the history of women's rights and the state of the art of gender equality in Denmark and around the world.
A very impressive Museum! You can get an immersed environment in side, and think about what does gender/sex mean to you since your childhood, and how does the gender equality go so far.

Absolutely love this museum! A great timeline of women’s rights in Denmark and elsewhere in the world. Displayed in a way that’s easy to understand. On the top floor they have some history of the Aarhus theatre too! Would highly recommend!
Bruh

The church is magnificent, but unfortunately we had an unpleasant experience there... We were there on Friday, the 7th July 2017, about 2 p.m. A foreign community (Korean, Chinese, Japanese...??) was preparing an action there. We were standing only at the back, were looking at the interior and were quietly, yet some of the people were looking at us nasty and unfriendly. But the worst was an old grey-haired woman who went around - she looked at me and hissed angrily. She resembled a furious rat... I was so disgusted and angry! What do they think about themselves?? If our presence was not suitable there, they could tell it politely and not to treat with us like with a rabble! We rather went out...
Stunning church and definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful one of the church.
Good looking church

Nice place to hang out and relax. It's a big park so it's always possible to find a free spot, although there are many people when the weather is good. The playground can, however, be well stocked. There are beautiful cherry trees and memorial monument to World War II soldiers.
Best place for families
Good spacious. Nice view. Grills available. Water available.
Fun but too windy
Great place for barbeque, making sport and have fun with kids!
Hot dogs the traditional Danish way plus a few other things including beef sandwich in the old fashioned way with brown sauce.
Dejlig mad og hurtig service
Lidt af udvalget
Her serveres både traditionelle pølser, gourmet pølser, hotdogs og gourmet hotdog og hjemmelavet tilbehør såsom løgrelish, agurkesalat mv. En af byens bedste pølsevogne.

A very disappointing experience. We had an argument with the server about what table to choose even though there was nobody there. Three times he told us to sit at the table next to the counter even though we wanted privacy in the corner. Finally we surrendered and moved table but it kind of affected the rest of our experience. Even the taste of the food.
Had a very nice rib eye steak there, and a few very Deliziioso espresso coffee at different times. Worth checking out.
Good pizza!
The food is just amazing, restaurant is very clean and run by Italian guy!! If you want to have Italian experience in Denmark you should definitely visit.
great atmosphere and delicious food :)
Great restaurant,  simple card, but the food is very very nice. I've been here before, but is has been taken over 10 days ago. I was pleasantly surprised. Will definitely come back the next time.

Starter and dessert were nice but the steak was not the best quality.  The staff are very friendly but I think they were having a few teething problems.  Credit card machine didn't work so we had to get cash from a local machine,  however the chef did guide us to it!
Pretty nice place. Went there with a group. Although the restuarant itself is quite small,  it feels very spacious. The service was nice and so was the staff
Good food and wine for the price. Cosy atmosphere and nice service.

It is a nice Restaurant with a very skilled and gentle waiter. He helped me and my friends with the choice of the right wine for the food we ordered. Food was very tasty and del cooked. There menu sports a good selection of meat and fish. Dessert are delicious. Stop there for the dinner if you are passing by. Price is not cheap, but affordable.

I had a pulled pork pizza and it was simply too very much pulled pork and the rest was mediocre. I mean maybe it's fine if you knew what to expect, but this isn't really what I consider a good pizza. The vegetarian pizza was described to me as 'basically a baked salad' (also way too much on it). I'll find another place next time. At least the service was alright and let me customize the pizza. It was too expensive for what it was. I did like the setting.
Unique style of pizza where the topping is the focus. Crust is crispy, sometimes to the point of toughness. Tastes good but heavy on the salt.

Great staff, clean and nice atmosphere, but I didn't care much for the pepperoni pizza I ordered. Considering the strange composition and relatively high cost, I'd expect something with a taste above average. I'll definitely come back, but my next order won't be pizza. Sorry guys.
Good atmosphere, friendly staff. When we were there it was crowded so it took a while to get the food to the table. Other than that all was good. Really tasty pizzas!
Great food and pizza, nice place but not recommended if you don't like loud surroundings. But still a great restaurant. My favourite.

Wouldn't go here for coffee or ice cream. Even waiters know that 🤫
But really fresh and tasty sushi tho!
Great food, great service, especially from a really friendly waitress name Crystal
It took them awhile to prepare the sushi, but they’re really worth the wait. Food is excellent, especially the rispapir laks and rispapir-ninja. This place is our new hangout.
Nice food, I really like the continuous ordering from a tablet
Love the ordering system with a tablet! The sushi was delicious, service was good. Nice and relaxed atmosphere.
Well made food, good atmosphere, great waiters.

Very nice, cosy restaurant.
The food was tasty and the waitress was very helpful.
Taste of overcooked meat and overpriced wine, unpleasent staff also. asked for the house wine, but was offered a netto wine "35 kr in supermarket but they asked 260kr." i mean come on....

A bit cramped space-wise.
Food was good, though.

Dinner party was superb, please keep reading. Celebrating my birthday i had 29 people coming for what was an unforgettable night. From the start Dario was very helpsome in putting together the menu and answer all questions ensuring me that the party was in good hands. From we arrived the the waiters took good care of us, byo wine delivered the day prior, was served. Food was cooked to order, for each guest and exceptionally good, all three courses (5 different options) It was hard to imagine how they could turn it out so consistent and at the same time. After the dinner they let us stay and dance until 3am. All my guests raved about the food and the party, no exceptions. Alexander
Amazing vegetarian food, generous portions. Loved it so much I didn't get a single picture.
Fantastic place, great waiters even better food
If you book a table for 8:15 & are told to wait outside in the rain even though you turn up at 8:18. And by 8:40 you haven’t even been given a menu, let alone an apology, you can just lose my custom

The food was outstanding and our server, Frederick, was special. He was happy to add a table outside, anticipated our needs, and was happy to serve us. A really enjoyable experience. Highly recommended.
Great atmosphere and very nice waiters. Highly recommended, but book a table
Large and nice Spanish restaurant with tapas and a la carte. Qualified and efficient serving staff
The greatest place to get tapas!

Overall a really great place. Delicious tapas-style plates with a Spanish theme. Not all the dishes are Spanish, there are also some local delicacies. Also a great selection of wine. With that being said, it is very expensive, the only reason that i spent that much money on food is because I had a gift card.

The food is great, very interesting and balanced. It can be a bit hard to pick out things that work well together but ask the staff they are very helpful. The atmosphere is pretty good and relaxed and overall we had a really good experience there. Best tapas I've had in Aarhus so far
Doesn't 5 stars say it all? :-D
Excellent service, food, atmosphere... Totally recommended
Good service. Food to heavy for my taste. 12 course menu but quite a number of tables had difficulties getting through all the dishes.
Great place with great team spicellay the manager jeppe  and unique food
very good twist on classic ingredients great service with a wonderful view. I hope they get a second star.
Very elegant restaurant guaranteed to give you a great experience.
World class fod - an epic experience.

Highly recommend this place for a delectable and well-seasoned dinner. We were happily hosted with a selected and well planned vegetarian four course menu at a short notice. You could see the thinking gone in by the kitchen and the staff for making our evening special. Would go back everytime.

My expectations was not met of a Michelin restaurant. The individual items on the plates was nice, but the composition together did not work, and there was not a connection between the dishes. 
The waiter was very nice and friendly.
Perfect food...
It was a very warm-hearted, calm yet lively restaurant. We had a wonderful time here.

My girlfriend and I went for the "Tasting Menu" and we were not dissapointed. The food was fantastic! Furthermore we got free delicious snacks, and loads of free focaccia bread with a superb aioli to complement it.
The staff was so friendly and helpful.
I can highly recommend this place. The food and wine are simply amazing.

What to say! Absolutely amazing restaurant. I was in Aarhus for a night and wanted to go out for dinner. The food here was breathtaking, the local is very nice and the staff is extremely kind! I would definitely come back here again. Fair prices for the service offered

Absolutly amazing food experience. Enjoyed an evening here with my family, enjoying a 8 course wine menu. All dishes was spectaculary and the wines fitted well to the taste of the individual dishes. The staff was friendly and informatie, ensuring all wishes and diatary restrictions were catered for. A place I need to revisit in the future.

Extremely good! Very nice staff, good atmosphere and nicely decorated. Like the good apace between tables for privacy. The food was excellent (lunch) and very cheap per dish. Each dish cost the same just pick what you want and can eat. The only thing was the pace. It went too quick but when we asked for a slower pace they adapted. I would definitely go here again. A great experience all over which I seriously recommend.
Very tasty, sophisticated dishes, great wine list. Friendly service, highly recommended!

This is a must go place in Aarhus. Casual and cosy ambiance with excellent food. A mix of interesting flavors and wonderful friendly service. Clearly a passionate and knowledgeable staff. Food is organic and sourced locally. We love it and will for sure be back!
great food (the best pork I have had in Denmark)and even more amazing service. I had the 5-course tasting menu. It's a real treat!
Great, almost innovative food and very attentive waiters. Highly recommended and inexpensive, too.

We loved our experience at Hærværk. You can tell that they spend a lot of time and attention into preparing each dish and it pays off. They serve their own take on new Nordic cuisine and it was simply delicious.
One word: fantastic, excellent food, surprising wine menu that supported the food amazingly
Super good fish-dishes!
Great food and location. Slow staff and lots of smell and noise from the open kitchen. Which in it self is a good idea adding to the atmosphere. Just not well executed here.

We are always looking forward to going to restaurant seafood. The courses are delicious, the wine is excellent and the service is great. We have been the a number of times.
It is great for both romantic dinner and for going out with friends. It's located just on the marina with water all around. If you go thy night you will be able to see the sun setting over Aarhus.

The food was not ok, the fish bone was red
We were told this was ok though it "seemed not to be our taste."
The menu card does not tell what is starter and what is main course price, so we got a big surprice when we received the bill. The waiters were very rude and accused us of trying to cheat on the restaurant. The place cannot be recommended.
Fantastic food and service, definitely recommendable!

Very good danish restaurant. Great food and drinks. The service was perfect and very helpful for me that i could not speak the local language.
I do recommend the set of herrings.

This place is great!!! It starts with the extremely nice, funny and attentive waiters. Goes over to great cozy atmosphere. And ends with really great food! Down to earth, classy Scandinavian food.
Highly recommended.

Really great place! Very attentive and friendly waiters. We enjoyed our food very much. Go for the 3 different kind of herring as a starter!
Be aware: the portions are quite large.
Cosy place with very kind service. Ask for the traditional menu. Enjoy the pottery and the atmosphere. Best with a bunch of friends.
Delicious Danish traditional food. Nice atmosphere.
Good food, friendly staff and decent prices.
Food was pretty good but the pancakes were burnt. I do not recommend the pancakes
This place is a must visit if you want to try a great beer, fantastic Danish food.... very nice old style and Danish traditional "kro"
Great traditional Danish food and good craft beer selection like Hornbeer.
Nice little place, great portions, though the food was not really my thing.
Delicious 'the burger' which was vegan of course! Great place. Try it out. If you ever consider eating a no meat burger, start here. Who needs meat anyway. They even have alpro here 👍

Happy to visit 100% vegan and organic takeaway place. Very friendly host.
Veggie burger bun could be better if a wholegrain rather fluffy white flour option yet gluten free. Iceberg salad being replaced with kale would make it even more healthier. Putty was over fried and a bit dry.

My new favourite place to eat in Aarhus. The City Burger is absolutely fantastic, especially with the additional vegan cheese! 

Super-friendly staff, nice relaxed atmosphere.

Good and delicious food. Nice personal, so sweet and also they have English menu. All food organic, even the "take away boxes" are environmentally friendly. Just a to warm place for the new Danish summer.
They changed name and menu, but became 100 times slower. I had to wait for my burger for 25 min and they didn’t even warn me that it will take such a long time!
Nice store. Compact, but has many things packed in there! Also offers many vegan options, and has friendly staff!
Good store for organic and vegan products, as well as cosmetics, but quite small, the range is not too big and they don't offer plastic free options
Healthy food. Excellent for vegan diet. The shop employees are very polite and helpful
Den bedste butik i Aarhus, af mange forskellige årsager.
Et mekka for øko lovers! ❤️❤️
Lovely place with innovative décor and amazing vegan food.
Nice menu cosy atmosphere
It is simple: it is on an international level the best fish restaurant I know. Smart cooking, charming service and a cosy place!
Very good and tasty dishes, carefully introduced and with love served. Of course, that will have its pricing.
Very cozy place. Best place for typical Danish foods
Nice selection and love the idea of suppoeting local entrepreneurs.

Little bit hidden, which is good for tourists not flocking in. Instead it's one of the multiple hipster hangouts where you can get good coffee and launch your startup at the same time. And the view from the top terrace is reminding me of Prague, in more than a few details. If you are local, definitely come here.
An excellent place to meet with like minded people, work, have a coffee and network, one of the coolest spots in town to be creative and learn from creatives.
A perfect atmosphere to work, study or book conference rooms for important meetings!
Best coworking café in Aarhus
Cool place to go nuts. :D
Best club in town!
BEST CLUB IN AARHUS!
Party party
Good coffee and quality pastries
Perfect start to the day
Umiddelbart meget dyrt og ikke specielt imponerende, købte en foccacia sandwich, men har ikke prøvet andet derfra..
Fantastiske fastelavnsboller!!!
Ok kaffe, lidt seje rundstykker, lidt dyrt
Nice bakery. Had coffee and cake.
Excellent, amazing food. Was worth traveling to Denmark from USA just for the food. Great job!
Marvelous quality
One of the best bakers in town. Particularly love their brown ciabatta and many pastries.
Great bread and pastries.

We had a cinnamon bun- it was good but nothing compared to some of the ones from
Copenhagen bakeries. The price was ok

I like the bakery, but in my opinion you should not think your bread is good, just because you have a good oven and the crust is very good.. 
I crave for a bread with a lot of seeds.. Like half/half. 
But there caramels are very good.
They have been nominated for the best croissant, but that I don't get.. For me you can't go down in layers. 
So a fine bakery but not for the value, in my opinion.
Everything is delicious, especially potato bread and croissant.
Far too 'fancy for the sake of it' and stupidly expensive
Amazing bakery with lots of goodies. Can be a bit pricey but it's very good quality
Cool place to go nuts. :D
Best club in town!
BEST CLUB IN AARHUS!
Party party
